conclusion: To determine what will happen when objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, we need to consider the forces acting on each object and the laws of physics.

The force acting on object A is equal to the force acting on object B.

The total momentum of the system remains constant due to the law of conservation of momentum.
The total momentum of objects A and B must be equal to the total momentum of objects C and D.
